description: From Middle English acresen, accreesen, from Anglo-Norman, Old French acreistre, from Latin accrēscere, from ad- + crēscere (“to grow”). Doublet of accresce.

examples: For then we shall have worke sufficient, without any more accrease.

verbs.description: accrease (third-person singular simple present accreases, present participle accreasing, simple past and past participle accreased)
